**R manual** ::: ## Overview of the module Module comprises two parts: - **Part I** Mathematical statistics - **Parti II** Applied statistics ## Overview of the module ### Part I - Mathematical statistics With a continuous probability density function $f(\cdot)$ the mean and variance can be calculated as \begin{gather*} \mbox{Mean}=E[X]=\int_{-\infty}^{\infty}x \, f(x)dx \\ a_1=b_1+c_1\\ a_2=b_2+c_2-d_2+e_2 \end{gather*} $$ E[X^2]=\int_{-\infty}^{\infty}x^2f(x)dx $$ $$ \mbox{Variance}=E[X^2]-(E[X])^2 $$ ## Overview of the module ### Part II [important note]{.alert} ::: {#thm-line} ## Line The equation of any straight line, called a linear equation, can be written as: $$ y = mx + b $$ ::: ::: {.callout-note} Note that there are five types of callouts, including: `note`, `warning`, `important`, `tip`, and `caution`. ::: ::: {.proof} The solution. ::: ## References
